# Entourage Brand & Design System **Version 4.0** | Last Updated: December 26, 2025 A comprehensive design system for Entourage, an AI-powered task management platform that extracts actionable items from meetings, chats, and communications. --- ## Table of Contents 1. [Brand Philosophy](#1-brand-philosophy) 2. [Target Audience](#2-target-audience) 3. [Logo System](#3-logo-system) 4. [Color Palette](#4-color-palette) 5. [Typography](#5-typography) 6. [Spacing & Layout](#6-spacing--layout) 7. [Borders & Dividers](#7-borders--dividers) 8. [Decorative Elements](#8-decorative-elements) 9. [Buttons](#9-buttons) 10. [Cards & Containers](#10-cards--containers) 11. [Icons](#11-icons) 12. [Animation & Motion](#12-animation--motion) 13. [Dark Mode](#13-dark-mode) 14. [Accessibility](#14-accessibility) 15. [Component Patterns](#15-component-patterns) 16. [Section Templates](#16-section-templates) 17. [Voice & Tone](#17-voice--tone) 18. [Implementation Reference](#18-implementation-reference) 19. [Quick Reference Card](#19-quick-reference-card) 20. [Changelog](#20-changelog) --- ## 1. Brand Philosophy ### Core Design Principle: Digital Swiss Style Entourage's design language derives from the International Typographic Style (Swiss design), adapted for modern AI tools. We prioritize: | Principle | Description | |-----------|-------------| | **Objectivity** | Information over emotion. Let the data speak. | | **Precision** | Grid-based layouts, consistent spacing, sharp corners. | | **Clarity** | High contrast, readable typography, functional color. | | **Density** | Information-rich interfaces that respect the user's time. | | **Functionality** | Every element serves a purpose. No decoration for decoration's sake. | ### Design Inspiration Our visual language draws from: - **Vercel** - Technical precision, blueprint aesthetics, developer-focused - **Linear** - Dense information display, keyboard-first, monospace accents - **Stripe** - Clear hierarchy, professional polish, trustworthy ### The "Technical Blueprint" Aesthetic Think of Entourage's interface as a technical drawing or blueprint: - Sharp corners (no rounded edges) - Dashed/dotted borders as construction guides - Plus signs (+) as measurement markers - Monospace text for data and labels - High contrast black/white with functional color accents --- ## 2. Target Audience ### Primary Users | Segment | Description | |---------|-------------| | **Product Managers** | Small startups (2-10 people), juggling multiple projects | | **IT Consultants** | Managing client communications across channels | | **Freelancers** | Digital nomads working across time zones | | **Solopreneurs** | Running businesses while handling operations | ### User Characteristics - **Tech-savvy**: Comfortable with modern tools and interfaces - **AI-forward**: Early adopters of AI productivity tools - **Time-constrained**: Value efficiency over hand-holding - **Multi-tasking**: Constantly switching between projects and contexts - **Mobile**: Often working from different locations ### Design Implications Because our users are busy professionals: - Keep interfaces dense but scannable - Prioritize keyboard navigation - Use monospace for data to signal "this is real information" - Avoid unnecessary animations that waste time - Support dark mode for extended screen time --- ## 3. Logo System ### The Mark: Bold E-Block ``` ████████ ████████ ████ ██ ████████ ████ ██ ████████ ``` The E-Block represents Entourage's core function: - **Vertical spine (40%)**: The AI kernel that processes and structures - **Horizontal bars (27% each)**: The unified task list (inputs → outputs) - **Thin gaps (10% each)**: Processing boundaries (raw data → structured action) ### Logo Specifications | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Aspect Ratio** | 1:1 (square) | | **Spine Width** | 40% of total width | | **Bar Height** | 27% each (3 equal bars) | | **Gap Height** | 10% each (2 equal gaps) | | **Minimum Size** | 32px | | **Clear Space** | 1/4 of mark width on all sides | ### Logo Colors | Context | Color | |---------|-------| | Light mode | Black (#000000) on white | | Dark mode | White (#FFFFFF) on black | | Transparent | Black or white on transparent | ### Logo Usage Rules **Do:** - Use at minimum 32px size - Maintain clear space around the mark - Use only black on white or white on black **Don't:** - Rotate or skew the logo - Add shadows, gradients, or effects - Use colors other than black/white - Distort the proportions - Place on busy backgrounds without contrast ### Logo with Wordmark When combining the logo with text: ``` [E-Block] Entourage ``` | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | Gap between mark and text | 8px (0.5rem) | | Text font | Geist Mono | | Text weight | Medium (500) | | Text size | Matches logo height | | Letter spacing | Wide (tracking-wide) | ### Logo Implementation ```tsx // src/components/Logo.tsx export function LogoMark({ size = 32, className }: LogoMarkProps) { return ( ); } ``` --- ## 4. Keep them snappy and purposeful. | Principle | Description | |-----------|-------------| | **Inform** | Animation communicates state changes | | **Snappy** | Short durations, no unnecessary delays | | **Accessible** | Respect prefers-reduced-motion | ### UI Animation Timing | Interaction | Duration | Easing | Purpose | |-------------|----------|--------|---------| | Hover state | Instant | — | Immediate feedback | | Toggle/switch | 120ms | ease-in-out | Clear state change | | Page transition | 150ms | ease-out | Visual continuity | | Scroll reveal | 120ms | ease-out | Content appearance | | Button press | 100ms | ease-in | Tactile feedback | | Fade up entrance | 150ms | ease-out | Staggered reveals | ### Ambient Animation Timing | Animation | Duration | Use Case | |-----------|----------|----------| | Logo pulse | 2-3s | Background brand presence | | Circuit signals | 3-5s | Data flow visualization | | Infinite scroll | 20-25s | Logo carousels | | Pulse rings | 2s | Processing indicators | ### Framer Motion Patterns #### Fade Up Entrance ```tsx const fadeUp = (delay: number) => ({ initial: { opacity: 0, y: 20 }, animate: { opacity: 1, y: 0, transition: { duration: 0.15, delay: prefersReducedMotion ? 0 : delay, ease: "easeOut", }, }, }); ``` #### Staggered Children ```tsx const containerVariants = { hidden: {}, visible: { transition: { staggerChildren: 0.15, }, }, }; const itemVariants = { hidden: { opacity: 0, y: 24 }, visible: { opacity: 1, y: 0, transition: { duration: 0.12, ease: "easeOut", }, }, }; ``` #### Scale on Scroll ```tsx animate={{ scale: isScrolled ? 0.85 : 1, }} transition={{ duration: 0.3, ease: [0.32, 0.72, 0, 1], }} ``` ### CSS Animations ```css /* Subtle pulse for logos */ @keyframes pulse-subtle { 0%, 100% { opacity: 0.85; transform: scale(1); } 50% { opacity: 1; transform: scale(1.02); } } .animate-pulse-slow { animation: pulse-subtle 3s ease-in-out infinite; } /* Infinite scroll for carousels */ @keyframes scroll { from { transform: translateX(0); } to { transform: translateX(-50%); } } .animate-scroll { animation: scroll linear infinite; } ``` ### Accessibility: Reduced Motion Always check user preferences: ```tsx import { useReducedMotion } from "framer-motion"; export function AnimatedComponent() { const prefersReducedMotion = useReducedMotion(); if (prefersReducedMotion) { return ; } return ; } ``` --- ## 13. Brand Philosophy ### Core Design Principle: Digital Swiss Style Entourage's design language derives from the International Typographic Style (Swiss design), adapted for modern AI tools. We prioritize: | Principle | Description | |-----------|-------------| | **Objectivity** | Information over emotion. Let the data speak. | | **Precision** | Grid-based layouts, consistent spacing, sharp corners. | | **Clarity** | High contrast, readable typography, functional color. | | **Density** | Information-rich interfaces that respect the user's time. | | **Functionality** | Every element serves a purpose. No decoration for decoration's sake. | ### Design Inspiration Our visual language draws from: - **Vercel** - Technical precision, blueprint aesthetics, developer-focused - **Linear** - Dense information display, keyboard-first, monospace accents - **Stripe** - Clear hierarchy, professional polish, trustworthy ### The "Technical Blueprint" Aesthetic Think of Entourage's interface as a technical drawing or blueprint: - Sharp corners (no rounded edges) - Dashed/dotted borders as construction guides - Plus signs (+) as measurement markers - Monospace text for data and labels - High contrast black/white with functional color accents --- ## 2. Target Audience ### Primary Users | Segment | Description | |---------|-------------| | **Product Managers** | Small startups (2-10 people), juggling multiple projects | | **IT Consultants** | Managing client communications across channels | | **Freelancers** | Digital nomads working across time zones | | **Solopreneurs** | Running businesses while handling operations | ### User Characteristics - **Tech-savvy**: Comfortable with modern tools and interfaces - **AI-forward**: Early adopters of AI productivity tools - **Time-constrained**: Value efficiency over hand-holding - **Multi-tasking**: Constantly switching between projects and contexts - **Mobile**: Often working from different locations ### Design Implications Because our users are busy professionals: - Keep interfaces dense but scannable - Prioritize keyboard navigation - Use monospace for data to signal "this is real information" - Avoid unnecessary animations that waste time - Support dark mode for extended screen time --- ## 3. Logo System ### The Mark: Bold E-Block ``` ████████ ████████ ████ ██ ████████ ████ ██ ████████ ``` The E-Block represents Entourage's core function: - **Vertical spine (40%)**: The AI kernel that processes and structures - **Horizontal bars (27% each)**: The unified task list (inputs → outputs) - **Thin gaps (10% each)**: Processing boundaries (raw data → structured action) ### Logo Specifications | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Aspect Ratio** | 1:1 (square) | | **Spine Width** | 40% of total width | | **Bar Height** | 27% each (3 equal bars) | | **Gap Height** | 10% each (2 equal gaps) | | **Minimum Size** | 32px | | **Clear Space** | 1/4 of mark width on all sides | ### Logo Colors | Context | Color | |---------|-------| | Light mode | Black (#000000) on white | | Dark mode | White (#FFFFFF) on black | | Transparent | Black or white on transparent | ### Logo Usage Rules **Do:** - Use at minimum 32px size - Maintain clear space around the mark - Use only black on white or white on black **Don't:** - Rotate or skew the logo - Add shadows, gradients, or effects - Use colors other than black/white - Distort the proportions - Place on busy backgrounds without contrast ### Logo with Wordmark When combining the logo with text: ``` [E-Block] Entourage ``` | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | Gap between mark and text | 8px (0.5rem) | | Text font | Geist Mono | | Text weight | Medium (500) | | Text size | Matches logo height | | Letter spacing | Wide (tracking-wide) | ### Logo Implementation ```tsx // src/components/Logo.tsx export function LogoMark({ size = 32, className }: LogoMarkProps) { return ( ); } ``` --- ## 4. Color Palette ### Core Colors Colors are functional signals, not decoration. We use a strictly monochromatic base with semantic colors for status. #### Base Palette | Name | Hex | RGB | Use | |------|-----|-----|-----| | **Black** | #000000 | 0, 0, 0 | Primary text, borders, logo (light mode) | | **White** | #FFFFFF | 255, 255, 255 | Backgrounds, text (dark mode) | #### Gray Scale (Zinc) | Name | Hex | Light Mode Use | Dark Mode Use | |------|-----|----------------|---------------| | **Zinc-100** | #F4F4F5 | Subtle backgrounds | — | | **Zinc-200** | #E4E4E7 | Dashed borders | — | | **Zinc-300** | #D4D4D8 | Dotted borders | — | | **Zinc-400** | #A1A1AA | Plus corners, labels | — | | **Zinc-500** | #71717A | Muted text | — | | **Zinc-600** | #52525B | — | Plus corners | | **Zinc-700** | #3F3F46 | — | Dotted borders | | **Zinc-800** | #27272A | — | Dashed borders | ### Functional Colors (Status) Colors communicate state, not brand. Use sparingly. | Status | Hex | RGB | Meaning | |--------|-----|-----|---------| | **Green** | #48BB78 | 72, 187, 120 | Success, complete, active | | **Purple** | #9F7AEA | 159, 122, 234 | AI action, processing | | **Yellow** | #F6E05E | 246, 224, 94 | Warning, pending review | | **Orange** | #ED8936 | 237, 137, 54 | In progress, working | | **Red** | #F56565 | 245, 101, 101 | Error, failed, destructive | ### Color Application Rules 1. **Never use color decoratively** - Every color must have semantic meaning 2. **Pair color with context** - A colored element alone isn't enough; add text or icon 3. **Use tints for backgrounds** - Full color for text/borders, 10% opacity for backgrounds 4. **Maintain contrast** - All text must meet WCAG AA (4.5:1 minimum) ### Color Examples ``` ✓ CORRECT: [Green dot] Task completed [Yellow banner] 3 items need review ✗ WRONG: [Purple rectangle] (no label) [Orange background on entire row] (ambiguous meaning) ``` --- ## 5.
